title: New Astronauts Join Space Station Team
summary: Four new astronauts arrived at the International Space Station on Saturday. They came in a SpaceX rocket from Cape Canaveral, Florida. The astronauts are from the United States, France, and Russia. Their names are Jessica Meir, Jack Hathaway, Sophie Adenot, and Andrei Fedyaev. They will live and work on the space station for eight to nine months. They are replacing other astronauts who had to leave early because one got sick. This is the first time NASA had to bring astronauts home early for health reasons in 65 years. The space station had only three people left, so NASA stopped spacewalks and reduced science experiments. Now, with the new crew, the station is back to full strength. The astronauts are excited to start their mission and help with research in space.

questions.question: How many new astronauts arrived at the space station?
Where did the SpaceX rocket launch from?
How long will the new astronauts stay on the space station?
Why did the previous astronauts leave early?
What did NASA stop doing when only three astronauts were left?

background_read: The International Space Station is a large spacecraft that orbits Earth. Astronauts from different countries live there to do science experiments and learn about space. Sometimes, astronauts have to come back to Earth early if there is a health problem. NASA works with companies like SpaceX to send astronauts to space using rockets. Spacewalks are important for fixing things outside the station, but they can be dangerous, so NASA is careful about when to do them.
Article_Structure: WHO: Four astronauts named Jessica Meir, Jack Hathaway, Sophie Adenot, and Andrei Fedyaev
WHAT: They arrived at the International Space Station to replace a crew that left early due to health issues
WHERE: The International Space Station, which is in space above Earth, and they launched from Cape Canaveral, Florida
WHY: To bring the space station back to full strength so astronauts can do more work and research in space

perspectives.description: Astronauts from different countries work together on the space station to achieve common goals like scientific research.
